name: godot-files
description: Additional features for some Godot files, better syntax-coloring and very basic GDShader support.

untrustedWorkspaces.description: Only declarative features like syntax coloring are enabled on untrusted workspaces.

commands.category: Godot Files: Active Documentation Page: Find
commands.title: Next Match

commands.category: Godot Files: Active Documentation Page: Find
commands.title: Previous Match

additionalProperties.description: Array of paths to Godot cache files for this platform id (as returned by NodeJS).

items.description: A path to Godot cache files in this platform.

godotFiles.godotCachePath.markdownDescription:
Paths to Godot cache files in each platform. The defaults should work in most cases. Add a path when using a Godot installation in [self-contained mode](https://docs.godotengine.org/en/stable/tutorials/io/data_paths.html#self-contained-mode). You can also remove paths you don't need in your OS for better performance.

The keys are platform ids as returned by NodeJS: `win32` (Windows), `darwin` (macOS), `linux`.

Each key maps to an array of path strings. A starting `~/` in the path is equivalent to `${userHome}/`. Substitution is also supported for `${workspaceFolder}` and `${env:VARIABLE}`. Glob patterns are *not* allowed. The order in the array doesn't matter, since all paths are always scanned to get the most recent cache file.

godotFiles.documentation.locale.markdownDescription:
Specifies the language to use in the [Godot Documentation](command:godotFiles.openApiDocs). Ignored by the `godot-tools` viewer, which only supports English.

ðŸ”’ Exclusive to [early access](command:godotFiles.unlockEarlyAccess) (otherwise, English will be used).
enumDescriptions:
Automatically Detected
The IDE language, or its closest match, or English if unavailable.

godotFiles.documentation.viewer.markdownDescription:
Specifies how the [Godot Documentation](command:godotFiles.openApiDocs) is opened when online.

This viewer is used when going to a class definition from a GDAsset file.

On other Godot files like GDScript, it's only used when triggering the **Open Godot API Documentation** command directly. This command opens the class list if nothing is selected, or a class page or a search page when an identifier is under the text cursor or a text is selected (if not using the `godot-tools` viewer).
markdownEnumDescriptions: Use **your browser** to open the documentation URL externally.

Use the built-in **Simple Browser** extension to open the documentation URL in an IDE tab.

 âœ³ï¸ Cannot open multiple tabs. The tab is always reused.

 ðŸ’» On web IDEs, this option is not supported and uses `browser` as a fallback.

Use a **tab in the IDE** to open the documentation website.

 âœ³ï¸ Any future website changes could potentially break this, so use a different viewer if you notice issues.

 âœ³ï¸ The search page uses `simple-browser` instead.

 ðŸ’» On web IDEs, this option is not supported and uses `browser` as a fallback.

Use the official **godot-tools** extension to open API documentation in a tab.

 âœ³ï¸ Requires the Godot Editor to be running and connected to that extension.

 âœ³ï¸ Only English is supported.

 âœ³ï¸ Always used as a fallback for the other viewers when you're offline.

godotFiles.documentation.webview.hideSid.markdownDescription:
Enable to show only the documentation content itself, hiding the navigation sidebar when loading a page (except for the home page).

 Applies only to the `webview` documentation viewer.

godotFiles.documentation.webview.keepTab.markdownDescription:
Enable to always open links in a new tab; otherwise you need to hold Ctrl or âŒ˜ when clicking a link to open it in a new tab.

 Applies only to the `webview` documentation viewer.

godotFiles.documentation.webview.redirec.markdownDescription:
When opening a class API page in a specific member, automatically redirect a missing member until its definition is found in a base class. Even when disabled, you can still click a link manually in the warning shown atop each page to try finding the inherited member in the next parent class. Supports only properties currently.

 Applies only to the `webview` documentation viewer.

godotFiles.hover.previewResource.description: Disable if you don't want tooltips to show an image preview of the resource or a link to it.

godotFiles.clarifyReferences.filePath.markdownDescription:
Show implied file paths as inlay hints after `ExtResource(â€¦)` and `uid://â€¦` references.

ðŸ”’ The uid references are only resolved in [early access](command:godotFiles.unlockEarlyAccess).
markdownEnumDescriptions: Show only the file name (with extension), even when different files have the same name.

Show the minimum path segments needed to have unique paths for different files, collapsing the common parents into `â€¦/`. This means it usually shows just the file name (with extension), and parent folders are shown only as needed to distinguish files with the same name. Note that a path is only collapsed if it's from `ext_resource`; otherwise it shows the full path.
Show the path reference exactly as declared.

godotFiles.clarifyReferences.class.markdownDescription: Show implied engine classes as inlay hints on `ExtResource(â€¦)` and `SubResource(â€¦)` references.
enumDescriptions: Show inlay hints only when the class cannot be inferred from the context.

godotFiles.clarifyReferences.asOperator.markdownDescription:
The postfix "as" operator to use in inlay hints before implied engine classes.

The IDE imposes a limitation of 43 characters per line in inlay hints before collapsing text into `â€¦`, so using a short string like `:>` (as in F#) is a good idea. If using a keyword like `as`, surround it with a space before and after it.

markdownEnumDescriptions: A single `#` character, to save the most space.
A short symbolic operator, resembling F#. Saves space while implying `as` semantics.
The `as` keyword, like it's used in C# and GDScript. Longer, but accurate and self-explanatory.

godotFiles.clarifyArrays.vector.description: Show implied parentheses around each vector in a packed array.

godotFiles.clarifyArrays.color.description: Show implied parentheses around each color in a packed array.

godotFiles.inlineColors.single.markdownDescription: Show inline color decorators on `Color(â€¦)` values.

godotFiles.inlineColors.array.description: Show inline color decorators on color values within packed arrays.

godotFiles.shader.analysisLevel.markdownDescription:
Specify how far the code is analyzed. This will influence dependent features to determine what you can get, such as the type (and amount) of diagnostics (like errors and warnings), which symbols are shown on outline, etc.

ðŸ”’ Applies only to GDShader language features, which is exclusive to [early access](command:godotFiles.unlockEarlyAccess). You can restrict this to disable the notification that more features are available on early access.
enumDescriptions: Disable all programmatic analysis on the code. You'll still get syntax coloring.

Do only preprocessor analysis on the code. Only features that depend on just the preprocessor will be available, such as preprocessor errors, preprocessor sourcemapping and preprocessor symbols on outline.
Run the preprocessor and the lexer. Like above, but it will also give you lexical errors.
Run the preprocessor, then lexer and parser. Like above, but it will also give you syntax errors.
Run all analyzers available, thus enabling all features that you can get. Currently the same as syntactical.

godotFiles.inactiveRegionOpacity.markdownDescription:
Control transparency of code within inactive regions, such as inside `#ifâ€¦#endif` directives that evaluate to false. This feature requires an analysis level of `preprocessor` or higher.

ðŸ”’ Applies only to GDShader language features, which is exclusive to [early access](command:godotFiles.unlockEarlyAccess).

scripts.compile: npm run compile-grammars && npm run compile-pc && npm run compile-web
scripts.vscode:prepublish: npm run compile-grammars && npm run compile-pc && npm run package-web
